values.help: NOTE: After parameter change to value 3, 4 or 5 first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!
values.label: Input 1 type

values.help: Responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.
values.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF

items.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

values.help: 0 => Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 32535  => 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s). Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter 15. Default value 0
values.label: Automatic turning off output after set time

values.help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 32535  => 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s). Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter 15. Default value 0
values.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
Saving the state of the device after a power failure

items.label: After a power failure, it returns to off position

values.help:
This parameter is influencing on the software only when the value of parameter number 1 is set to value 3, 4 or 5.
			In manual mode regulation (how the input influence on output) is disabled.
values.label: Auto or manual selection

values.help:
NOTE: When ZERO PID inside deadband is forced to zero. 
			Last value means that PID remains on same level as was before entering into deadband.
values.label: PID value inside deadband

values.help:
0 to 100 => 0 to 100%, step is 1%. 
			Default value 1.
			NOTE: This parameter defines the zone where PID is not active. If the temperature difference between actual and setpoint is bigger than PID deadband, then the PID will start to regulate the system, otherwise the PID is zero or fixed.
values.label: PID deadband

values.help:
0 to 127 => 0 to 127s, step is 1s. 
			Default value 1.
			Parameter defines the time between samples. On each sample the controller capture difference between SP-act.
values.label: - Integral sampling time

values.help:
0 to 1000, step is 1. 
			Default value 100.
values.label: P parameter

values.help:
0 to 1000, step is 1. 
			Default value 1.
values.label: I parameter

values.help:
0 to 1000, step is 1. 
			Default value 1.
values.label: D parameter

values.help:
1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value.
			Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).
values.label: Minimum dimming value

values.help:
2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value.
			Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).
values.label: Maximum dimming value

values.help:
Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through.
			1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds.
			Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).
values.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)

values.help:
Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1.
			1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds.
			Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).
values.label: Dimming time when key pressed

values.help:
This parameter is used with association group 4.
				A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0.
				A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1.
				Default value 0.
values.label: Ignore start level

values.help:
This parameter is used with association group 3.
				The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value.
				A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value.
				Default value 0.
values.label: Dimming duration

values.help:
From 1 to 100 - value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature.
                From 1001 to 1100 - value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.
values.label: Temperature sensor offset settings

values.help:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.
                Available settings: 0 - Reporting disabled.
                1 - 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C.
values.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting

values.help:
If analogue sensor is connected, module reports measured value on change defined by this parameter.
			0 - Reporting disabled.
			1 to 10000, step is 0.1. 			
			Default value 5 => 0.5C.
values.label: Input I1 Sensor reporting

values.help:
Parameter is associated with Association group No. 2.
			Below this value, the Association No. 2 will report Basic Set 0xFF and above this value will report Basic Set 0xFF.
			Basic Set is reported only, when the input value changes for more than 10% (1V). 
			Default setting: 5 (0.5V)
			1 to 100 => (0,1 to 10V)
values.label: 1 Input I1 0-10V reporting threshold

values.help:
Value that must correspond to minimum sensor range value.
			Valid only if parameter 1 is set to values 3, 4 or 5).
			default value 0 = 0.0C / 0Lux / 0.0%rh
			0 to 10000 => value from 0 to 1000 (resolution 0,1)
			10001 to 20000 => value from -0,1 to -1000 (resolution 0,1)
			NOTE: Minimum value must not be higher than maximum value!
values.label: Minimum sensor range value

values.help:
Value that must correspond to maximum sensor range value.
			Valid only if parameter 1 is set to values 3, 4 or 5).
			default value 1000 = 100.0C / 100Lux / 100.0%rh
			0 to 10000 => value from 0 to 1000 (resolution 0,1)
			10001 to 20000 => value from -0,1 to -1000 (resolution 0,1)
			NOTE: Maximum value must not be lower than minimum value!
values.label: Maximum sensor range value
